mlneuro.regression.bayes¶

class mlneuro.regression.bayes.PoissonBayesBinnedRegressor(ybins=32, encoding_model='quadratic', model_type='glm', n_jobs=-1, use_prior=False, nan_unvisited=False)[source]¶

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, mlneuro.regression.base.BinnedRegressorMixin

fit(X, y, **glm_fit_kwargs)[source]¶

Train Naive Bayes Decoder :param X: This is the neural training data.

See example file for an example of how to format the neural data correctly
Parameters:y (numpy 2d array of shape [n_samples, n_outputs]) – This is the outputs that are being predicted (training data)
predict(X)[source]¶

Predict values of y given X

Parameters:X (array-like of shape = [n_samples, n_features]) – The input samples.
Returns:y (array of shape = [n_samples, n_dims]) – The center of the highest probability bin for each sample
predict_log_proba(X)[source]¶

Predict the log-probability of each y bin given X

Parameters:X (array-like of shape = [n_samples, n_features]) – The input samples.
Returns:log(p(y|X)) (array of shape = [n_samples, n_bins]) – The log conditional probability distribution over the y bins given a sample X
predict_proba(X)[source]¶

Predict the probability of each y bin given X

Parameters:X (array-like of shape = [n_samples, n_features]) – The input samples.
Returns:p(y|X) (array of shape = [n_samples, n_bins]) – The conditional probability distribution over the y bins given a sample X
